extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Bruschetta Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Place flour and eggs in separate shallow bowls. In a third bowl, combine bread crumbs and cheese. Dip chicken in flour, then eggs; coat with bread crumb mixture.                                                                                            Place in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Drizzle with butter. Bake, uncovered, at 375째 for 25-30 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 170째.                                                                                           In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon over the chicken. Return to the oven for 3-5 minutes or until tomato mixture is heated through.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Bruschetta Chicken in  The Taste of Home Cookbook2006, p166                                                                                                                                                                                                       Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 topped chicken breast equals 380 calories, 14 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 185 mg cholesterol, 589 mg sodium, 19 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 42 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Place flour and eggs in separate shallow bowls. In a third bowl, combine bread crumbs and cheese. Dip chicken in flour, then eggs; coat with bread crumb mixture.
Place in a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, at 375째 for 25-30 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 170째.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon over the chicken. Return to the oven for 3-5 minutes or until tomato mixture is heated through.
